item.title: Flappy Bird
item.description:
Minimal version of Flappy Bird implemented using HTML and JavaScript

To add submodules to a repository,

$ git submodule add <>

Play the game here.

Find the GitHub repo here.

item.title: Never-Lose-Tic-Tac-Toe üí™
item.description:
Optimized minimax algorithm in C# to build a Tic-Tac-Toe which never loses to you *wynk*

This was done for fun as a first attempt at Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC).

Find pre-requisites of using this application and usage instructions here.

Find the GitHub repo here.

item.title: Gmail Attachments Fetcher
item.description:
Intuitive, useful, complete interface for fetching your Gmail attachments from a particular sender

This was done for fun as a first attempt at Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC).

Find pre-requisites of using this application and usage instructions here.

Find the GitHub repo here.

item.title: SRM Network Login
item.description:
SRM University Unofficial Network Login Android Application

This is a lightning fast network login application made using Tasker, ~~not Android Studio~~.

This relies on sending an HTTP request directly rather than through the browser.

The original script written by @thewisenerd can be found here. This script is packaged and modded into this present application.

v1 : using qPython; and the UI wasn‚Äôt intuitive.

v2 : using Termux (with silent script execution)

Deps : (python, pip-requests, pip-rsa) on Termux, Termux:Task

Find the GitHub repo here.

SRM University Unofficial Network Login Desktop Application

This is another lightning fast network login application made for Desktop OSs (Linux / Ubuntu / MacOS) using QtPython.

Same login script was used.

Find the GitHub repo here.

item.title: BARADX : Track your Satellite
item.description:
The TTC Dashboard for BARADX

Presently,

‚Ä¢ Get input packets from two Arduinos

‚Ä¢ Put the respective parameters in the corresponding fields

‚Ä¢ Plot the latitude-longitude in the Maps API {GMaps, OpenStreetMap, BingMaps}

‚Ä¢ Display gauges and bars

‚Ä¢ Watch your satellite navigate across the globe

Find the GitHub repo here.

item.title: pyxcy - The C++ code editor made using Python
item.description:
GUI framework used : Tkinter

Language support : C / C++

Main features :

‚Ä¢ Keyword colouration

‚Ä¢ Line numbering

‚Ä¢ Auto-indentation

‚Ä¢ Auto-save

Find the GitHub repo here.

item.title: Serial Port Communication between ŒºC and PC
item.description:
A GUI interface was made using C# which had the following resposibilities :

‚ùá Collecting the input values from user

‚ùá Parse the given values into a 32-byte string

‚ùá Send to the microcontroller through RF

‚ùá Scan for input from the port continuously

‚ùá Output string received as a string containing output values

‚ùá Processing the string to retrieve and display

Find the GitHub repo here.

item.title: Blogger vs Blog(er)
item.description:
Once, a less mature version of me started blogging with Google. He just dragged-and dropped things and they worked (of course within bounds). He just kick-started the GUI and things ran. He was blogging effortlessly, yet limitedly.

Then he studied web development and started coding a blog on GitHub. The first version of the blog doesn‚Äôt have much colours, menus and ads; yet it looks decent (and purposely minimal). Now, the blogging isn‚Äôt fully effortless (requires manhours), but the possibilities are now expanded to ‚àû.

Find a link to my (once) personal blog here.
